compiler

Class OntologyFileGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • compiler.OntologyFileGenerator

  • public class OntologyFileGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    Generates the ontology in form of an nt-File for a given SceneMakerAutomaton.
    Author:
    Jana Jungbluth

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private SceneMakerAutomaton automat
      The SceneMakerautomaton for which the ontology is generated.
      private java.lang.String file_path
      The file_path where the generated ontology is stored (given as input).
      private java.util.List<java.lang.String> owl_objects
      A list of owl objects used in the ontology.
      private java.util.List<java.lang.String> relations
      A list of relations used in the ontology.
      private java.util.List<java.lang.String> types
      A list of type definitions used in the ontology.
      private java.lang.String uri_for_domain_range_subClass
      The URI used for the relations 'domain', 'range' and 'subclass' in the ontology.
      private java.lang.String uri_for_owl_objects
      The URI used for owl objects in the ontology.
      private java.lang.String uri_for_type_relation
      The URI used for type relations in the ontology.
      private java.lang.String uri_for_types
      The URI used for type definitions in the ontology.
      private java.lang.String uri_own
      The URI to be used for nodes and variables in the ontology (given as input).

      Creates a new ntFileGenerator based on automat.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OntologyFileGenerator

        public OntologyFileGenerator(SceneMakerAutomaton automat,
                             java.lang.String uri,
                             java.lang.String filepath)
        Creates a new ntFileGenerator based on automat. The generated file will use uri and be stored at filepath.
        Parameters:
        automat - The SceneMakerAutomaton the ontology is to be generated for.
        uri - The URI used for nodes and variables in the ontology.
        filepath - The path for the nt-File that will be generated.

    • Method Detail

      • find_uri

        private java.lang.String find_uri(java.lang.String string)
        Returns the correct URI needed for the given definition.
        Parameters:
        string - The definition the matching URI has to be returned for.
        Returns:
        the matching URI for the given definition.

      • find_uri_relation

        private java.lang.String find_uri_relation(java.lang.String string)
        Returns the correct URI needed for the given relation.
        Parameters:
        string - The relation the matching URI has to be returned for.
        Returns:
        the matching URI for the given relation.

      • create_brackets

        private java.lang.String create_brackets(java.lang.String uri,
                                         java.lang.String string)
        Adds the correct syntax to create an nt-element.
        Parameters:
        uri - The URI of the nt-element.
        string - The name of the object of the nt-element.
        Returns:
        A complete nt-element.

      • write_line

        private void write_line(java.lang.String first,
                        java.lang.String relation,
                        java.lang.String second,
                        java.io.BufferedWriter bw)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Writes one line of the ontology into the given file. This contains the definition of the relation between two objects.
        Parameters:
        first - The first object of the relation.
        relation - The relation between the two objects.
        second - The second object of the relation.
        bw - The buffered writer the line is written into.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • write_property

        private void write_property(java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String type,
                            java.lang.String domain,
                            java.lang.String range,
                            java.io.BufferedWriter bw,
                            boolean functional)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the definition of a property into the ontology file.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the property.
        type - The type of the property.
        domain - The domain of the property.
        range - The range of the property.
        bw - The buffered writer the output is written into.
        functional - A Boolean that describes if the property is a functional property.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
